MONL.content: I always surrender myself to language: give credit to that which is to come (as opposed to the given)
MONL.linkedContent: I always surrender myself to language: give credit to that which is to come (as opposed to the given)

MONL.content: Derrida on his relation to French language; the secret, a tattoo, blood mixed w/ ink, love by setting on fire, graft, mark, let come to itself in itself
MONL.linkedContent: Derrida on his relation to French language; the secret, a tattoo, blood mixed w/ ink, love by setting on fire, graft, mark, let come to itself in itself

POR.content: Derrida [in preparation for this Cornell address] felt like a cornered animal, while worrying he would be like Elijah, an eschatological harbinger
POR.linkedContent: Derrida [in preparation for this Cornell address] felt like a cornered animal, while worrying he would be like Elijah, an eschatological harbinger

POO.content: can a confession or auto-critique (this whole seminar is about me) ever occur? who is the reader of whom?
POO.linkedContent: can a confession or auto-critique (this whole seminar is about me) ever occur? who is the reader of whom?

POO.content: “the secret remains intact, my politeness [see S p. 9] unblemished, my reserve unbreached, my modesty more jealous than ever [see TB p. 124]” [respond w/out responding]
POO.linkedContent: “the secret remains intact, my politeness [see S p. 9] unblemished, my reserve unbreached, my modesty more jealous than ever [see TB p. 124]” [respond w/out responding]

SPOM.content: l’archarnement (ferocity, w/ chair, flesh) d’un chasseur > set out the living lifeless body of a ghost (le corps vivant sans vie d’un fantôme) to trick prey (pour tromper sa proie)
SPOM.linkedContent: l’archarnement (ferocity, w/ chair, flesh) d’un chasseur > set out the living lifeless body of a ghost (le corps vivant sans vie d’un fantôme) to trick prey (pour tromper sa proie)

SPOM.content: Derrida has a feeling about this, and it’s projected into what he’s doing: “it is never possible to avoid this precipitation, since everyone reads, acts, writes with his or her ghosts, even when one goes after the ghosts of others”
SPOM.linkedContent: Derrida has a feeling about this, and it’s projected into what he’s doing: “it is never possible to avoid this precipitation, since everyone reads, acts, writes with his or her ghosts, even when one goes after the ghosts of others”

POOF.content: [Derrida “confesses,” in parentheses, intended method to go beyond Aristotle]

when Blanchot claims that Judaism was the foundation of our relationships w/ the other (autri), Derrida believes this is highly problematic while possessing imposing necessity (this is unquestionable when one calls Judaism the thing one defines: a circle Derrida can’t engage here [heterotautology?]) > Derrida wonders why he can’t subscribe, like Blanchot, to words “community” or this statement on Judaism—which response is more hyperbolically Jewish?
POOF.linkedContent: when Blanchot claims that Judaism was the foundation of our relationships w/ the other (autri), Derrida believes this is highly problematic while possessing imposing necessity (this is unquestionable when one calls Judaism the thing one defines: a circle Derrida can’t engage here [heterotautology?]) > Derrida wonders why he can’t subscribe, like Blanchot, to words “community” or this statement on Judaism—which response is more hyperbolically Jewish?

POOF.content: Derrida confessing: he has more than one ‘brother,’ of more than one sex, and he loves having more than one (uniquely bound, each time, by a conjuration & so many unuttered oaths)
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida confessing: he has more than one ‘brother,’ of more than one sex, and he loves having more than one (uniquely bound, each time, by a conjuration & so many unuttered oaths)

HASD.content: in topolitology of secret, figures or places of rhetoric are also political stratagems [Derrida & deconstruction?]
HASD.linkedContent: in topolitology of secret, figures or places of rhetoric are also political stratagems [Derrida & deconstruction?]

HASD.content: most “autobiographical” [attach as many quotation marks around this word as possible] to leave out Jew & Arab, which Derrida has never been able to speak about [see p. 58]
HASD.linkedContent: most “autobiographical” [attach as many quotation marks around this word as possible] to leave out Jew & Arab, which Derrida has never been able to speak about [see p. 58]

MPM.content: Derrida overwhelmed by memories of de Man, everything is painful, so painful
MPM.linkedContent: Derrida overwhelmed by memories of de Man, everything is painful, so painful

MPM.content: Derrida, lover of memory, never knew how to tell a story, never received gift (doron) of Mnemosyne, the wax imprint, an eidolon [Derrida has a relation to memory beyond the imprint?]: keeps the memory loses the narrative
MPM.linkedContent: Derrida, lover of memory, never knew how to tell a story, never received gift (doron) of Mnemosyne, the wax imprint, an eidolon [Derrida has a relation to memory beyond the imprint?]: keeps the memory loses the narrative

MPM.content: I can’t tell stories so I turn to myth > Mnemon: an auxiliary, a technician, artist of memory, hypomnesic servant [Derrida?]
MPM.linkedContent: I can’t tell stories so I turn to myth > Mnemon: an auxiliary, a technician, artist of memory, hypomnesic servant [Derrida?]

A.content: whenever someone speaks of someone else, cites or praises him or her, one must hear: this is the story of my life [re: Diderot accusing Seneca, pardoning Seneca, asking for pardon himself]
A.linkedContent: whenever someone speaks of someone else, cites or praises him or her, one must hear: this is the story of my life [re: Diderot accusing Seneca, pardoning Seneca, asking for pardon himself]

A.content: that which lives w/ out a name, we’ll give an added name (surnom) [which a name always is]: Marrano (crypto-judaic, crypto-X), believe if you want to the Marranos have come to an end
A.linkedContent: that which lives w/ out a name, we’ll give an added name (surnom) [which a name always is]: Marrano (crypto-judaic, crypto-X), believe if you want to the Marranos have come to an end

A.content: Marranos that we are, whether we know it or not, incessantly older & younger, untimely histories, still waiting for the other in a last word infinitely finished
A.linkedContent: Marranos that we are, whether we know it or not, incessantly older & younger, untimely histories, still waiting for the other in a last word infinitely finished

A.content: Marrano: anyone who remains faithful to a secret he hasn’t chosen
A.linkedContent: Marrano: anyone who remains faithful to a secret he hasn’t chosen

PAS.content: what i would like to give you: Viens w/out language overhang (sans aucun langage de surplomb), w/out anything that could name it, designate it from a third place
PAS.linkedContent: what i would like to give you: Viens w/out language overhang (sans aucun langage de surplomb), w/out anything that could name it, designate it from a third place

PAS.content: Derrida’s ideal to drown in true sea of Blanchot’s text, to have loved it as the original first name
PAS.linkedContent: Derrida’s ideal to drown in true sea of Blanchot’s text, to have loved it as the original first name

FWT.content: incalculable inner multiplicity is Derrida’s torment, his work, travail, his tripalium, passion, labor, also that which makes him work > I do not believe this division/nonidentity to oneself is exemplarily Jewish, but who would dare say it isn’t?
FWT.linkedContent: incalculable inner multiplicity is Derrida’s torment, his work, travail, his tripalium, passion, labor, also that which makes him work > I do not believe this division/nonidentity to oneself is exemplarily Jewish, but who would dare say it isn’t?

FWT.content: nothing matters more to Derrida than his Jewishness, & it matters so little
FWT.linkedContent: nothing matters more to Derrida than his Jewishness, & it matters so little

DS.content: “psychic Proteus,” perfect scoundrel [definition of mime, of Derrida?]
DS.linkedContent: “psychic Proteus,” perfect scoundrel [definition of mime, of Derrida?]

ROP.content: Derrida loves French word résistance, loaded w/ pathos of his nostalgia, dreams of bombing in the ‘40s > secret of inconsolable nostalgia resists analysis, kinda like navel of dream
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida loves French word résistance, loaded w/ pathos of his nostalgia, dreams of bombing in the ‘40s > secret of inconsolable nostalgia resists analysis, kinda like navel of dream

ROP.content: Derrida frustrated that at colloquia no one ever goes into detail, swept away by voice, do w/out minutiae of letter (the micrological displacements where I incorrigibly persist in hoping things get decided—at a given moment, that’s never given)
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida frustrated that at colloquia no one ever goes into detail, swept away by voice, do w/out minutiae of letter (the micrological displacements where I incorrigibly persist in hoping things get decided—at a given moment, that’s never given)

ATIA.content: if you suspect me of perversion [re: “it really was a little black pussycat”], it’s always a possibility
ATIA.linkedContent: if you suspect me of perversion [re: “it really was a little black pussycat”], it’s always a possibility

ATIA.content: Derrida is going to put off reading of Heidegger until later, then says that later might just mean never
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida is going to put off reading of Heidegger until later, then says that later might just mean never

ATIA.content: the indulgent way one poses in front of a camera
ATIA.linkedContent: the indulgent way one poses in front of a camera

ATIA.content: Derrida on all the memories he has of Cerisy, he hallucinates them, a chimera, a haunted castle, and his talk that year his most chimerical
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida on all the memories he has of Cerisy, he hallucinates them, a chimera, a haunted castle, and his talk that year his most chimerical

ATIA.content: Derrida’s very early dream, obsession, before his bestiary [his texts], of an absolute hospitality (to so many animots), infinite appropriation—constituting everything thought or written w/in a zoosphere
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida’s very early dream, obsession, before his bestiary [his texts], of an absolute hospitality (to so many animots), infinite appropriation—constituting everything thought or written w/in a zoosphere

ATIA.content: Derrida’s exceptionalism, sentiment of election, always exempted himself, in everything he’s written, erased, traced, from the “they” who name the “animal” > “as if I were the secret elect of what they call animals”
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida’s exceptionalism, sentiment of election, always exempted himself, in everything he’s written, erased, traced, from the “they” who name the “animal” > “as if I were the secret elect of what they call animals”

ATIA.content: Derrida’s dreams, many dreams, dreams of animals dreaming, loves watching them sleep
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida’s dreams, many dreams, dreams of animals dreaming, loves watching them sleep

ATIA.content: “as for me, the guilty innocent one, the accused presumed innocent and guilty at the same time, I who confesses even to the sin of confession” > qui/que suis-je?
ATIA.linkedContent: “as for me, the guilty innocent one, the accused presumed innocent and guilty at the same time, I who confesses even to the sin of confession” > qui/que suis-je?

ATIA.content: single embrace of Kant, Descartes, Levinas, Lacan, Heidegger, like chasing, hunting, trying to take hold of cuttlefish, touch the animal in a way where it will expel its ink (encre), its anchor, in this case, w/ these folks, the ink as the ability to do the “I,” before autoreference; (in the name of autobiography) Derrida confides the animalist “vision” he has of what he does, what he writes > his “sole concern” is to not sacrifice to it any difference, fold, opening to-come
ATIA.linkedContent: single embrace of Kant, Descartes, Levinas, Lacan, Heidegger, like chasing, hunting, trying to take hold of cuttlefish, touch the animal in a way where it will expel its ink (encre), its anchor, in this case, w/ these folks, the ink as the ability to do the “I,” before autoreference; (in the name of autobiography) Derrida confides the animalist “vision” he has of what he does, what he writes > his “sole concern” is to not sacrifice to it any difference, fold, opening to-come

ATIA.content: I’m not trying to be the last one speaking, the last Jew, the last of the eschatologists > I would like to write a long text one day
ATIA.linkedContent: I’m not trying to be the last one speaking, the last Jew, the last of the eschatologists > I would like to write a long text one day

O.content: I will not feign, acc. code, either premeditation or improvisation
O.linkedContent: I will not feign, acc. code, either premeditation or improvisation

O.content: Derrida not disputing la raison elle-même, the one (masculine) libido—“why not?” > to stand on head [call for feminine libido?] would put back/leave in place truth of phallocentric dialectic
O.linkedContent: Derrida not disputing la raison elle-même, the one (masculine) libido—“why not?” > to stand on head [call for feminine libido?] would put back/leave in place truth of phallocentric dialectic

WAP.content: re: coming “late” to think critically about teaching philosophy, Derrida explains he is not going to display histrionic guilt, as a matter of taste
WAP.linkedContent: re: coming “late” to think critically about teaching philosophy, Derrida explains he is not going to display histrionic guilt, as a matter of taste

SW.content: Derrida knows too well how to do the history of veils > there’s the fault: “commencer…à bien faire” (TN. “begin to do too well” or “it’s getting to be too much”); tiresome, tireless, tired out history I’m leaving behind me, running after me
SW.linkedContent: Derrida knows too well how to do the history of veils > there’s the fault: “commencer…à bien faire” (TN. “begin to do too well” or “it’s getting to be too much”); tiresome, tireless, tired out history I’m leaving behind me, running after me

SW.content: has Derrida left no one the right to say the veil has something to hide? that it will suffice to have done w/ veil to access Thing itself (Cause safe & intact)?
SW.linkedContent: has Derrida left no one the right to say the veil has something to hide? that it will suffice to have done w/ veil to access Thing itself (Cause safe & intact)?

SW.content: “I like to touch more than to see” [his tallith]
SW.linkedContent: “I like to touch more than to see” [his tallith]

SW.content: “I’d like to be done w/ mourning [for the veil]…perhaps [H.C.] already succeeded in that”
SW.linkedContent: “I’d like to be done w/ mourning [for the veil]…perhaps [H.C.] already succeeded in that”

SW.content: “as for swapping one’s tunic w/ a woman, who can be sure of never being ‘in abomination’?” not me, I fear
SW.linkedContent: “as for swapping one’s tunic w/ a woman, who can be sure of never being ‘in abomination’?” not me, I fear

SW.content: “I continue to murmur, under the protection of hypothesis”
SW.linkedContent: “I continue to murmur, under the protection of hypothesis”

SW.content: Derrida’s call, grain of a telephone ring: véraison (vary, change color, moment of ripening)—the moment the unforeseeable reappropriation of the silkworm took place > the surprise I had to expect never makes a mistake, took place only once, demands all time given to become what it was: the verdict, what a note, what news > as if nothing evil ever happened again, or only happen w/ death: “too late” > Derrida will never tell this tale, he promised
SW.linkedContent: Derrida’s call, grain of a telephone ring: véraison (vary, change color, moment of ripening)—the moment the unforeseeable reappropriation of the silkworm took place > the surprise I had to expect never makes a mistake, took place only once, demands all time given to become what it was: the verdict, what a note, what news > as if nothing evil ever happened again, or only happen w/ death: “too late” > Derrida will never tell this tale, he promised

DPi.content: [another example of “ses” chances: was talking dawn then found it capitalized in The Execution]
DPi.linkedContent: [another example of “ses” chances: was talking dawn then found it capitalized in The Execution]

DPi.content: I [Derrida] am against the DP, I am interested in saving my neck, the life I love: and by “I,” I mean “I,” me, and also whoever says “I” in its place or in mine: ultimate resource of my interest in the end of DP—an interest so originary/primordial, it risks being shared by supporters of DP?
DPi.linkedContent: I [Derrida] am against the DP, I am interested in saving my neck, the life I love: and by “I,” I mean “I,” me, and also whoever says “I” in its place or in mine: ultimate resource of my interest in the end of DP—an interest so originary/primordial, it risks being shared by supporters of DP?

DPi.content: Montaigne: fairest death is the most willed death, pulled like a thread > Derrida imagines [via fil of life, filet of blood] a tireless trapeze artist who is caught by net of belief, his opinion, dies on day net breaks, a willed/beautiful death > he decides to put an end to his belief
DPi.linkedContent: Montaigne: fairest death is the most willed death, pulled like a thread > Derrida imagines [via fil of life, filet of blood] a tireless trapeze artist who is caught by net of belief, his opinion, dies on day net breaks, a willed/beautiful death > he decides to put an end to his belief

CHM.content: re: his relation to Foucault: interminable unhappiness (unhappy consciousness) of disciple > master might be absent
CHM.linkedContent: re: his relation to Foucault: interminable unhappiness (unhappy consciousness) of disciple > master might be absent

CHM.content: must break the mirror, the glass, infinite speculation on master: start to speak
CHM.linkedContent: must break the mirror, the glass, infinite speculation on master: start to speak

CHM.content: philosophy as this giant confession: attempt-to-say-the-hyperbole (to define it as such is to confess) > I philosophize only in terror, but in confessed terror of going mad
CHM.linkedContent: philosophy as this giant confession: attempt-to-say-the-hyperbole (to define it as such is to confess) > I philosophize only in terror, but in confessed terror of going mad

CHM.content: confession is simultaneously: oblivion/unveiling, protection/exposure > economy

Gii.content: Derrida writes on typewriter w/ 3 hands btwn 3 tongues [re: 3rd ear as ear of other, a supplementary readability of Heidegger]
Gii.linkedContent: Derrida writes on typewriter w/ 3 hands btwn 3 tongues [re: 3rd ear as ear of other, a supplementary readability of Heidegger]

REST.content: interlacing of interruption points, a purely faked multiplicity [Derrida confessing about the multiple voices, the dialogue occurring in essay?], periods remain w/out destination, but they have authority in common [cf. ATM how do interruptions interlace?]
REST.linkedContent: interlacing of interruption points, a purely faked multiplicity [Derrida confessing about the multiple voices, the dialogue occurring in essay?], periods remain w/out destination, but they have authority in common [cf. ATM how do interruptions interlace?]

REST.linkedContent: you’re trying to justify [Heidegger] at any price? his “pathetic tirade”

REST.content: if Heidegger is not referring to painted shoes w/in the limits of a frame, which can only be crossed in one direction (from outside to inside), then…
REST.linkedContent: if Heidegger is not referring to painted shoes w/in the limits of a frame, which can only be crossed in one direction (from outside to inside), then…

PIO.linkedContent: friendship w/ de Man, cloudless (sans ombre): rarest, most precious rays of light (traits de lumière)

HLP.content: I will not tell you the whole truth about a history of the lie, not even what I think it’s necessary to say, I will not say the whole truth of what I think: a lacunary testimony
HLP.linkedContent: I will not tell you the whole truth about a history of the lie, not even what I think it’s necessary to say, I will not say the whole truth of what I think: a lacunary testimony

TR.linkedContent: Derrida analyzing de Man on Rousseau admits he doesn’t see things clearly enough [re: a certain point]

EJQB.content: [re: his commentary on Jabès] adding pitiful (misérables) graffiti to an immense poem
EJQB.linkedContent: [re: his commentary on Jabès] adding pitiful (misérables) graffiti to an immense poem

PSSS.content: Derrida, advancing to a new theater of cruelty, wants to avoid alibis, will be very slow: prefers incorrigibly long [therapy] sessions [:)]
PSSS.linkedContent: Derrida, advancing to a new theater of cruelty, wants to avoid alibis, will be very slow: prefers incorrigibly long [therapy] sessions [:)]

PSSS.linkedContent: Derrida’s Socratic-like “I know nothing,” doesn’t know where to put his knowing nothing (who authorizes his questions?)

HST.content: Derrida so shy in his incompetence w/ Arabic
HST.linkedContent: Derrida so shy in his incompetence w/ Arabic

HST.content: Derrida tells this story: he was thinking of substitution, he thought of the example of stealing a child, replacing it w/ another, then he went to Littré (as a matter of duty, to verify, to search for an example), and the first definition/example is child substitution [mes chances]

+R.content: resonances leading you astray, what if I like words in order to be-tray (pour trahir) > (pour traiter, triturer, traîner, tramer, tracer, traquer)
+R.linkedContent: resonances leading you astray, what if I like words in order to be-tray (pour trahir) > (pour traiter, triturer, traîner, tramer, tracer, traquer)

C.linkedContent: I shall not speculate: let that be clear forever; the objects don’t belong to me, not mine; still, it’s difficult to resist obsidional invasion (investissement)

C.content: Derrida, in Glas, incorrectly thought Genet was talking about a trouser pocket
C.linkedContent: Derrida, in Glas, incorrectly thought Genet was talking about a trouser pocket

LI.linkedContent: Derrida feels certain sense of guilt for not having incorporated some of Searle’s texts in SEC, even though they were written later

LI.content: even Derrida’s discourse involves effect of idealism in some way
LI.linkedContent: even Derrida’s discourse involves effect of idealism in some way

LI.content: Derrida’s incorrigible naïveté: confidence in ethics of discussion (in morality, if not in moralism)
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s incorrigible naïveté: confidence in ethics of discussion (in morality, if not in moralism)

LI.content: Derrida’s “conservatism”: I am for safeguards, memory, jealous conservation of #s of traditions (in university & in scientific, philosophical, literary theory) > I am actively committed to safeguards: at same time (in same text), I call into question foundation of these traditions
LI.linkedContent: Derrida’s “conservatism”: I am for safeguards, memory, jealous conservation of #s of traditions (in university & in scientific, philosophical, literary theory) > I am actively committed to safeguards: at same time (in same text), I call into question foundation of these traditions

TN.content: “soul,” “body,” “being”: I never understood these words, same for everyone?
TN.linkedContent: “soul,” “body,” “being”: I never understood these words, same for everyone?

TN.content: I dream one day some statistics [baby daddy] will reveal how often I used them (w/out confessing how unsure I was of their exact meaning)
TN.linkedContent: I dream one day some statistics [baby daddy] will reveal how often I used them (w/out confessing how unsure I was of their exact meaning)

TN.content: has Derrida singled out frapper, caresser for pedagogical, provisional convenience—tie them to later texts?
TN.linkedContent: has Derrida singled out frapper, caresser for pedagogical, provisional convenience—tie them to later texts?

TN.content: touch does not come as easily to Derrida as it does to Nancy—isn’t Nancy’s [every] origin “appropriable”?
TN.linkedContent: touch does not come as easily to Derrida as it does to Nancy—isn’t Nancy’s [every] origin “appropriable”?

TN.content: Derrida not more idealist, history of touch is idealistic—“cannot bring myself to believe in it very much”
TN.linkedContent: Derrida not more idealist, history of touch is idealistic—“cannot bring myself to believe in it very much”

TN.content: dream of kissing Nancy, real friends intimidate me, as do my sons
TN.linkedContent: dream of kissing Nancy, real friends intimidate me, as do my sons

TN.content: pregnancy, only a woman can feel the heart of another in her; [Derrida to Nancy before surgery] “Don’t worry, I’ll wake up w/ you,” friend who keeps heart of other, this incredible survival > “heart” joins w/ thinking, w/ grace of gratitude, w/ love of friendship

ATM.linkedContent: Levinas contaminates when he thematizes the nonthematizable, Derrida contaminates this irrepressible thematization in his turn (not structurally, but w/ a fault of his own)

WOG.linkedContent: my relationship to ‘Greece’ is somewhat naive, limited by philological & historical incompetence

ATAP.content: Derrida didn’t know when he wrote Pas that “Viens” came from John Patmos
ATAP.linkedContent: Derrida didn’t know when he wrote Pas that “Viens” came from John Patmos
